agriculture.name: Agriculture & Agro-Processing
agriculture.tagline: Sri Lanka as a sustainable, value-added agri and food processing hub.
overview: Sri Lanka's Agriculture and Agro-Processing sector offers strong investment potential through rich biodiversity, favorable agro-climatic conditions, and a long export legacy.
Year-round cultivation, growing value addition, and export-oriented processing make the sector a competitive destination for long-term investors.
whyInvest: Rich agricultural base with high-value crops including tea, spices, coconut, fruits, and vegetables
Strategic access to India, the Middle East, Europe, and Africa for processed food exports
Strong brand and export potential with preferential trade access such as EU GSP+, UK DCTS, and regional FTAs
Skilled and cost-competitive talent pool for quality control, processing, and agri supply-chain operations
Improving logistics, cold storage, and distribution networks supporting lower post-harvest losses
Growing sustainability and traceability alignment for premium global markets
advantages: BOI-backed fiscal incentives including customs duty and PAL/CESS relief during implementation
Accelerated allowances (100-150%, up to 200% in eligible regions) and extended loss carry-forward
Fast-track approvals, visa support, and 100% foreign ownership for agro-processing projects

tourism.name: Tourism & Leisure
tourism.tagline: Sri Lanka as a year-round, diversified tourism destination.
overview: Sri Lanka's tourism sector combines strong destination appeal, cultural depth, and resilient recovery momentum.

With record arrivals in 2025 and continued policy support through visa simplification and infrastructure upgrades, the country presents high-potential opportunities across hospitality, leisure, MICE, and tourism services.
whyInvest: Compact destination mix with beaches, highlands, heritage sites, wildlife parks, and wellness offerings
Year-round tourism flows supported by dual monsoon seasons across different regions
Strong global brand recognition and broad source-market demand across Asia, Europe, and GCC
Investor-friendly framework with BOI facilitation, structured approvals, and tourism-focused support
Rising demand for cultural, eco, and experience-led travel with long-term expansion potential
Well-trained English-speaking hospitality workforce supported by tourism institutes
advantages: BOI fiscal support including customs duty and PAL/CESS relief for eligible projects
Tourism-specific CESS exemption on furniture imports for qualifying investments
Fast-track approvals, visa assistance, 100% foreign ownership, and full profit repatriation

urban.name: Urban, Residential & Mixed-Use Development
urban.tagline: Shaping future cities through integrated urban living.
overview: Sri Lanka's urban development sector offers long-term opportunities driven by urban migration, rising middle-income demand, and integrated city planning.
The pipeline spans high-density residential, mixed-use communities, commercial hubs, and smart urban infrastructure supported by regeneration initiatives and private participation.
whyInvest: Rapid urbanization is increasing demand for apartments, serviced units, and integrated communities
Growing middle-class purchasing power supports modern housing and lifestyle-led developments
Transport and connectivity investments are improving accessibility and property value potential
Demand is rising for smart, sustainable, and mixed-use developments with premium tenant appeal
Large untapped demand remains for modern living spaces, co-living, and township formats
Strong professional ecosystem in architecture, engineering, construction, and real-estate services
advantages: BOI-supported fiscal incentives for capital imports and implementation-phase cost relief
Accelerated tax allowances and extended loss carry-forward for qualifying projects
Fast-track approvals, 100% foreign ownership, full repatriation, and visa assistance

ict.name: ICT, Innovation & Tech Park Development
ict.tagline: Sri Lanka as a regional digital innovation and technology hub.
overview: Sri Lanka's ICT sector is a high-growth export engine supported by a skilled English-proficient workforce, digital infrastructure, and a growing startup ecosystem.
With strong export momentum and national digital priorities, the country offers a compelling platform for technology services, innovation parks, and advanced digital infrastructure.
whyInvest: Strategic location and time-zone alignment for ITES, BPO, and software exports to global markets
Large skilled and cost-competitive workforce with continuous graduate supply in ICT fields
Consistent ICT export growth and strong demand across cloud, fintech, and software services
Mature connectivity base with near-universal digital access and expanding fiber plus 4G/5G networks
Emerging innovation ecosystem in fintech, healthtech, e-commerce, and cloud solutions
Improving cyber security and data standards aligned with international digital practices
advantages: BOI facilitation for digital investments, including implementation-phase duty and tax relief
Concessionary 15% CIT for eligible service exports plus accelerated depreciation benefits
Fast-track approvals, 100% foreign ownership, repatriation support, and investor visa assistance

education.name: Higher Education & Vocational Education
education.tagline: Sri Lanka: South Asia's emerging education and skills hub.
overview: Sri Lanka offers strong education-sector potential through high literacy, significant unmet demand, and competitive operating economics.
The country is well positioned for private higher education, vocational training, and transnational education models with BOI support and scalable project pathways.
whyInvest: Strong unmet demand as large numbers of qualified students cannot access public pathways each year
Cost-competitive setup and operations compared with major regional education hubs
Skilled academic and training base across STEM, ICT, healthcare, management, and applied sciences
English-medium delivery supports international curricula, dual degrees, and global partnerships
Regional catchment potential across South Asia, Maldives, the Middle East, and Africa
Education is a policy priority with BOI-enabled flexibility for higher foreign participation
advantages: Priority areas include international campuses, TVET, healthcare training, EdTech, and applied skills institutes
BOI can approve foreign ownership above the general 40% education limit on eligible projects
Fast-track approvals, fiscal incentives, repatriation support, and investor visa facilitation

transport.name: Transport & Logistics
transport.tagline: Strengthening regional supply chains through smart logistics infrastructure.
overview: Sri Lanka's Transport and Logistics sector is a core trade enabler with strong growth in freight, warehousing, and multimodal distribution.
With rising e-commerce demand, high market value, and infrastructure upgrades, the sector offers scalable opportunities across domestic and regional supply-chain platforms.

Strong volume growth from trade expansion, port throughput, and domestic logistics demand
Robust infrastructure base with ongoing upgrades in expressways, logistics hubs, and digital systems
Rising demand from manufacturing, agriculture, healthcare, tourism, and e-commerce value chains
Skilled workforce and competitive operating costs improve long-term investment margins
Decade-long growth potential supported by trade liberalization and supply-chain modernization
advantages: BOI incentives include concessionary CIT for eligible service exports and capital import relief
Accelerated depreciation allowances and extended loss carry-forward for qualifying projects

aviation.name: Aviation, Ports & Maritime Infrastructure
aviation.tagline: Invest at the crossroads of global trade in Sri Lanka's ports, airports, and maritime infrastructure.
overview: Sri Lanka's aviation, ports, and maritime sector is central to regional trade and mobility across the Indian Ocean.
Record port throughput, rising passenger traffic, and strategic connectivity create long-horizon opportunities in terminals, cargo, maintenance, training, and multimodal infrastructure.
whyInvest: Prime location on East-West trade routes with efficient access to regional and global markets
High-performing port ecosystem with expansion potential in container, bulk, and industrial cargo
Expanding aviation connectivity driving demand for airport infrastructure and service platforms
Rising trade and cargo volumes requiring modern shipping, storage, and distribution systems
Greenfield and brownfield expansion opportunities across terminals, logistics parks, and services
Skilled workforce and established support industries reduce implementation and operating friction
advantages: BOI-backed fiscal incentives on construction materials and capital goods during implementation
Accelerated allowances and long loss carry-forward windows for eligible infrastructure projects

manufacturing.name: Manufacturing
manufacturing.tagline: Sri Lanka as a competitive, export-oriented manufacturing hub in South Asia.
overview: Sri Lanka's manufacturing sector is a major contributor to GDP and exports, with established strength in apparel and growing diversification into electronics, pharmaceuticals, food processing, and engineering.
Strategic location, trade access, and BOI-backed facilitation support scalable and resilient industrial growth.
whyInvest: Strategic location on major shipping lanes with efficient access to key regional and global markets
Skilled, trainable workforce with strengths across apparel, electronics, and process manufacturing
Preferential market access through FTAs, EU GSP+, UK DCTS, and regional trade arrangements
Established industrial ecosystem with export zones, sector clusters, and multinational presence
Rising demand for sustainable and value-added products across multiple subsectors
Supportive policy push for export growth and sector diversification beyond traditional segments
advantages: BOI incentives for both capital and operational cost reduction, including import-duty relief on eligible inputs
Accelerated tax allowances and extended loss carry-forward to improve long-term project returns

With strong solar, wind, hydro, and biomass resources and BOI-supported facilitation, the market is positioned for scalable clean infrastructure investment.

Clear national transition pathway with decarbonization targets and long-term planning visibility
Strong PPP and private participation potential in generation, storage, grid, and utility services
Rising electricity demand from industrialization, urbanization, and digital-economy growth
Strong ESG alignment and climate-finance relevance for global sustainable capital
Emerging upside in storage, electric mobility infrastructure, green hydrogen, and smart-grid technologies
